hanzi-su-wiki:
単

Значения

Одиночный; просто, только

Мнемоника

Сокращение. Вилы для отцеживания навозной жижи. Густая фракция идёт на топливо. Состоят из ручки 十 и сита 日. Точки вверху — рты. Нападения на господ с вилами и криком — редки и единичны.

Варианты

單, 单

单单		単single, individual, only, lone

heisig_constituent: simple, owl, rice field, brains, ten, needle
koohiiStory1: Owls are smart...for this owl everything is simple coz his brain is ten times more powerful than mine.
koohiiStory2: An owl´s brain is ten times smarter than other simple minded birds…　RTK2:　タン　簡単　かんたん(simple).
jp_example_words:
単一(たんいつ): single, simple, sole, individual, unitory
単調(たんちょう): monotony, monotone, dullness
単独(たんどく): sole, independence, single, solo (flight)
単(ひとえ): one layer, single
単位(たんい): unit, denomination, credit (in school)
単語(たんご): word, vocabulary, (usually) single-character word
単純(たんじゅん): simplicity
単数(たんすう): singular (number)
単なる(たんなる): mere, simple, sheer
単に(たんに): simply, merely, only, solely
簡単(かんたん): easy, simple
WaniKani_Meaning_Mnemonic: The simple radical and the simple kanji are the same!
WaniKani_Reading_Mnemonic: One of the most simple things in the world is getting a tan (たん). All you have to do it stand outside long enough. It doesn't matter what skin type you have or what the weather is like. Eventually, if you stand out there long enough, you'll get a tan.
WaniKani_Reading_Info: Get a tan, it's simple, stupid! (Though it's terrible for you so uh... don't always take our advice, kay?)
Kanshudo_mnemonic: ten (十) small (⺍) rice fields (田) - should be simple!

単字的基本解释

単
dān
同“单”（日本汉字）。

単字的汉语字典释义

[①]［dān］
［《廣韻》都寒切，平寒，端。］
“单1”的繁体字。
(1)单独；一个。
(2)引申为孤独。
(3)谓衣物等单层。
(4)指用单层布帛制成的衣物。
(5)引申谓衣物单薄。
(6)泛指衰弱；寡少。
(7)简单；单纯。参见“單方”、“單調”。
(8)轮番更休。《诗·大雅·公刘》：“其軍三單。”毛传：“三單，相襲也。”陈奂传疏引胡承珙後笺：“三單者，即《周禮》‘凡起徒役，無過家一人’之謂。蓋止用正卒爲軍，不及其羡，故曰‘單’。三軍，故曰‘三單’。傳云‘相襲’者，猶言相代。則三軍之中，尚有更休叠上之法。”亦指相袭，继承。《书·洛诰》：“考朕昭子刑，乃單文祖德。”曾运乾正读：“單，襲也。言父死子繼，周家傳國常典。”一说指光大。参阅周秉钧《尚书易解》。
(9)记载事、物的纸片或票证。
(10)僧人坐禅、礼佛之具。
(11)古代钱卜用语。钱卜时，以三钱掷之，两面一背为单，两背一面为拆，三钱皆背为重，三钱皆面为交。见《仪礼·士冠礼》“筮與席所卦者”唐孔颖达疏。参阅清钱大昕《十驾斋养新录·筮用钱》。

Basic explanation of words
Unit
dān
Same as "Single" (Japanese Kanji).
Unit
Chinese dictionary definition of words
[①]［dān］
["Guangyun" are all cold cut, flat cold, end. ]
Traditional characters for "单1".
(1) Alone; one.
(2) The extension is loneliness.
(3) It is a single layer such as clothing.
(4) Refers to clothing made of a single layer of fabric.
(5) By extension, the clothes are thin.
(6) Generally refers to weakness; few and few.
(7) Simple; simple. See "unilateral", "monotonic".
(8) Take turns to rest. "Poetry·Daya·Gong Liu": "The three orders of his army." Mao Chuan: "Three orders, the same as each other." Chen Huan Chuan quoted Hu Chengyu's postscript: "Three orders, that is, the "Zhou Li" "Fan Qi Apprenticeship" , There is no such thing as a single person in the family. Gaizhi uses the pawn as the army, and it is not enviable, so it is called'single'. The three armies, so it is called'three singles.' Among the three armies, there is still a way to stack up." It also refers to attack and inheritance. "Shu·Luogao": "The test of Zhaozi's punishment is Shanwen Zude." Zeng Yunqian was reading: "Single, attack also. Saying that father died and son succeeded, the Zhou family passed on the country's permanent code." One said that Guangda. See Zhou Bingjun's "Easy Explanation of Shangshu".
(9) A piece of paper or ticket that records things and things.
(10) A tool for monks to sit in meditation and worship Buddha.
(11) Ancient terms of money divination. When making money, three coins are tossed, with two sides and one back for single, two backs and one side for splitting, three cashes are heavy, and three cashes are handed in face. See "Yi Li·Shi Guan Li" "Tang Kong Ying Da Shu," "Chen and Xi Suo Gua". Please refer to Qing Qian Daxin's "New Record of Ten Drivers' Free Raising·Song Money".

Radicals: 単  (simple)
Meaning Mnemonic
The simple radical and the simple kanji are the same!
Simple is simple!
Reading Mnemonic
One of the most simple things in the world is getting a tan (たん). All you have to do it stand outside long enough. It doesn't matter what skin type you have or what the weather is like. Eventually, if you stand out there long enough, you'll get a tan.
Get a tan, it's simple, stupid! (Though it's terrible for you so uh... don't always take our advice, kay?)
